pull.title: Getting ready to Qt 6 (7/n). Do not pass `WalletModel*` to a queued connection
pull.body:
On master (094d9fda5ccee7d78a2e3d8b1eec17b8b6a33466), the following queued connection https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/blob/094d9fda5ccee7d78a2e3d8b1eec17b8b6a33466/src/qt/rpcconsole.cpp#L1107 uses a `const WalletModel*` parameter regardless whether the `ENABLE_WALLET` macro is defined.

Although this code works in Qt 5, it is flawed. On Qt 6, the code gets broken because the fully defined `WalletModel` type is required which is not the case if `ENABLE_WALLET` is undefined.

This PR fixes the issue described above.

repo.name: gui
repo.description: Bitcoin Core GUI staging repository. Please do not fork unless for development reasons.

committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1650466667 +0200

refactor: Guard `RPCConsole::{add,remove}Wallet()` with `ENABLE_WALLET`

rename.from: Getting ready to Qt 6 (7/n). Pass `WalletModel*` pointer to signal only when `ENABLE_WALLET` defined
rename.to: Getting ready to Qt 6 (7/n). Do not pass `WalletModel*` to a queued connection

events.body:
Concept ACK.

An alternative is to ditch the 2nd argument, like (untested):
```cpp
Q_SIGNALS:
    // For RPC command executor
    void cmdRequest(const QString &command
#ifdef ENABLE_WALLET
        , const WalletModel* wallet_model
#endif
    );
```

```cpp
    Q_EMIT cmdRequest(cmd
#ifdef ENABLE_WALLET
        , m_last_wallet_model
#endif
    );
```

@promag

> Concept ACK.
> 
> An alternative is to ditch the 2nd argument, like (untested):
> 
> ```c++
> Q_SIGNALS:
>     // For RPC command executor
>     void cmdRequest(const QString &command
> #ifdef ENABLE_WALLET
>         , const WalletModel* wallet_model
> #endif
>     );
> ```
> 
> ```c++
>     Q_EMIT cmdRequest(cmd
> #ifdef ENABLE_WALLET
>         , m_last_wallet_model
> #endif
>     );
> ```

A similar approach was in my initial implementation -- https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr589.01 :)

But it somehow breaks interaction with `moc` compiler when using MSVC.

author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1650494386 +0200
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1650542696 +0200

Do not pass `WalletModel*` to queued connection

Passing a `WalletModel*` object to a queued connection when the
`ENABLE_WALLET` macro is undefined make code flawed.
